comments: After a(4) = 2, there are no primes in this sequence. Every element thereafter has at least two prime factors, the semiprimes (intersection of A007436 and A001358) starting 4, 6, 134, 831374, ... - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Dec 15 2004
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
formula: Row sums of the triangle generated by A054525 * A127647. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 22 2007
mathematica: mt[n_] := Block[{d = Divisors[n]}, Plus @@ (MoebiusMu /@ (n/d)*Fibonacci /@ d)]; Table[ mt[n], {n, 38}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ Dec 10 2004 *)a[n_] := DivisorSum[n, Fibonacci[#] MoebiusMu[n/#]&]; Array[a, 40] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 01 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 10 2004
